'''YouTube''' is an American social media and online video sharing platform owned by [[w:Google|Google]]. 

This website is used by both independent content creators such as [[LDShadowLady]], [[DanTDM]], and [[Element Animation]], or by professional corporations like [[Mojang Studios]] to share or promote their creations.

== Collaborations ==
=== One Trillion Views ===
In 2021, the Minecraft community on YouTube had reached approximately one trillion views. To celebrate, several projects were created, including [[One Trillion Minecraft Views on YouTube and Counting|two]] [[Minecraft Celebrates the Community! (Yes, that means you!)|videos]], a [[YouTube Creators Skin Pack|skin pack]], and a web page.<ref>{{Citation|url=https://www.youtube.com/trends/articles/minecraft-trillion/|title=YouTube Culture & Trends - One Trillion Views of Minecraft on YouTube - Data Visualization|author=YouTube Culture & Trends, Polygraph, Aphmau, Bahri, BriannaPlayz, CaptainSparklez, JeromeASF, Logdotzip, MatPat, PrestonPlayz, TheAtlanticCraft, and xisuma|website=YouTube|date=December 15, 2021}}</ref><ref>{{ytl|fPiSHuiwQiQ|One Trillion Minecraft Views|CaptainSparklez|December 15, 2021}}</ref>

== YouTube originals ==
=== Cinematics ===
{{main|Cinematics (disambiguation)}}
To promote various updates and projects, several [[Mojang cinematics]] have been released, typically featuring [[Character|characters]] such as [[Sunny]], [[Efe]], and [[Noor]] going on various adventures. Similar shorts have also been released for spin-off projects, including ''{{MCSM|Mojang cinematics|Minecraft: Story Mode}}'', ''{{MCD|Mojang cinematics|Minecraft Dungeons}}'', and ''{{MCE|Mojang cinematics|Minecraft Earth}}.''

=== Machinimas ===
{{main|Mojang machinimas}}
Prior to the introduction of cinematics, the majority of trailers produced for the franchise consisted of {{Wikipedia|machinima}} animations, a style where video games are manipulated and staged for animation purposes instead of a formal software. Many of these were created by the YouTubers [[Hat Films]].

=== Shorts ===
{{main|Mojang shorts}}
Beginning in 2020, YouTube added a special section of their website to finding "short form" content, in response to political tensions over [[TikTok]]. Several [[Mojang shorts]] have been released on the platform, as well as additional [[Marketplace shorts]].
